00025 #ifndef TIXML_STRING_INCLUDED
00026 #define TIXML_STRING_INCLUDED
00027 
00028 #include <assert.h>
00029 
00030 /*
00031    TiXmlString is an emulation of the std::string template.
00032    Its purpose is to allow compiling TinyXML on compilers with no or poor STL support.
00033    Only the member functions relevant to the TinyXML project have been implemented.
00034    The buffer allocation is made by a simplistic power of 2 like mechanism : if we increase
00035    a string and there's no more room, we allocate a buffer twice as big as we need.
00036 */
00037 class TiXmlString
00038 {
00039   public :
00040     // TiXmlString constructor, based on a string
00041     TiXmlString (const char * instring);
00042 
00043     // TiXmlString empty constructor
00044     TiXmlString ()
00045     {
00046         allocated = 0;
00047         cstring = NULL;
00048     }
00049 
00050     // TiXmlString copy constructor
00051     TiXmlString (const TiXmlString & copy);
00052 
00053     // TiXmlString destructor
00054     ~ TiXmlString ()
00055     {
00056         empty_it ();
00057     }
00058 
00059     // Convert a TiXmlString into a classical char *
00060     const char * c_str () const
00061     {
00062         if (allocated)
00063             return cstring;
00064         return "";
00065     }
00066 
00067     // Return the length of a TiXmlString
00068     unsigned length () const;
00069 
00070     // TiXmlString = operator
00071     void operator = (const char * content);
00072 
00073     // = operator
00074     void operator = (const TiXmlString & copy);
00075 
00076     // += operator. Maps to append
00077     TiXmlString& operator += (const char * suffix)
00078     {
00079         append (suffix);
00080         return *this;
00081     }
00082 
00083     // += operator. Maps to append
00084     TiXmlString& operator += (char single)
00085     {
00086         append (single);
00087         return *this;
00088     }
00089 
00090     // += operator. Maps to append
00091     TiXmlString& operator += (TiXmlString & suffix)
00092     {
00093         append (suffix);
00094         return *this;
00095     }
00096     bool operator == (const TiXmlString & compare) const;
00097     bool operator < (const TiXmlString & compare) const;
00098     bool operator > (const TiXmlString & compare) const;
00099 
00100     // Checks if a TiXmlString is empty
00101     bool empty () const
00102     {
00103         return length () ? false : true;
00104     }
00105 
00106     // Checks if a TiXmlString contains only whitespace (same rules as isspace)
00107     bool isblank () const;
00108 
00109     // single char extraction
00110     const char& at (unsigned index) const
00111     {
00112         assert( index < length ());
00113         return cstring [index];
00114     }
00115 
00116     // find a char in a string. Return TiXmlString::notfound if not found
00117     unsigned find (char lookup) const
00118     {
00119         return find (lookup, 0);
00120     }
00121 
00122     // find a char in a string from an offset. Return TiXmlString::notfound if not found
00123     unsigned find (char tofind, unsigned offset) const;
00124 
00125     /*  Function to reserve a big amount of data when we know we'll need it. Be aware that this
00126         function clears the content of the TiXmlString if any exists.
00127     */
00128     void reserve (unsigned size)
00129     {
00130         empty_it ();
00131         if (size)
00132         {
00133             allocated = size;
00134             cstring = new char [size];
00135             cstring [0] = 0;
00136         }
00137     }
00138 
00139     // [] operator 
00140     char& operator [] (unsigned index) const
00141     {
00142         assert( index < length ());
00143         return cstring [index];
00144     }
00145 
00146     // Error value for find primitive 
00147     enum {  notfound = 0xffffffff,
00148             npos = notfound };
00149 
00150     void append (const char *str, int len );
00151 
00152   protected :
00153 
00154     // The base string
00155     char * cstring;
00156     // Number of chars allocated
00157     unsigned allocated;
00158 
00159     // New size computation. It is simplistic right now : it returns twice the amount
00160     // we need
00161     unsigned assign_new_size (unsigned minimum_to_allocate)
00162     {
00163         return minimum_to_allocate * 2;
00164     }
00165 
00166     // Internal function that clears the content of a TiXmlString
00167     void empty_it ()
00168     {
00169         if (cstring)
00170             delete [] cstring;
00171         cstring = NULL;
00172         allocated = 0;
00173     }
00174 
00175     void append (const char *suffix );
00176 
00177     // append function for another TiXmlString
00178     void append (const TiXmlString & suffix)
00179     {
00180         append (suffix . c_str ());
00181     }
00182 
00183     // append for a single char. This could be improved a lot if needed
00184     void append (char single)
00185     {
00186         char smallstr [2];
00187         smallstr [0] = single;
00188         smallstr [1] = 0;
00189         append (smallstr);
00190     }
00191 
00192 } ;
00193 
00194 /* 
00195    TiXmlOutStream is an emulation of std::ostream. It is based on TiXmlString. \n
00196    Only the operators that we need for TinyXML have been developped.
00197 */
00198 class TiXmlOutStream : public TiXmlString
00199 {
00200 public :
00201     TiXmlOutStream () : TiXmlString () {}
00202 
00203     // TiXmlOutStream << operator. Maps to TiXmlString::append
00204     TiXmlOutStream & operator << (const char * in)
00205     {
00206         append (in);
00207         return (* this);
00208     }
00209 
00210     // TiXmlOutStream << operator. Maps to TiXmlString::append
00211     TiXmlOutStream & operator << (const TiXmlString & in)
00212     {
00213         append (in . c_str ());
00214         return (* this);
00215     }
00216 
00217     void write (const char * out, int length)
00218     {
00219         if (length > 0)
00220             append (out, length);
00221     }
00222 
00223     // Put a simple char to the output stream
00224     void put (char outchar)
00225     {
00226         append (outchar);
00227     }
00228 } ;
00229 
00230 #endif
